Literature Review: Dr. James Ntambi's pioneering work in the field of nutritional biochemistry has significantly advanced our understanding of the intricate relationships between diet, nutrients, and metabolism. His groundbreaking research on the role of de novo lipogenesis pathways in regulating metabolism has far-reaching implications for the prevention and treatment of metabolic disorders. This literature review aims to provide an overview of Dr. Ntambi's contributions to the field, highlighting his key findings, methodologies, and impact on the scientific community. We will also discuss the significance of his work in the context of malnutrition, nutrient-gene interactions, and fat metabolism, as well as his commitment to experiential learning and education. A comprehensive review of the literature will be presented, with a focus on the key concepts and findings that have shaped Dr. Ntambi's research agenda and legacy in the field of nutritional biochemistry.
